qwen2.5.full_ans:
```json
{'output': 'yes'}
```

The documents indicate that Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer (MGM) served as the distributor of the movie "Brewster McCloud" in the United States.

llama3.1.reason: The text states "Brewster McCloud was co-produced by Robert Altman’s nascent Lion’s Gate Productions (not to be confused with today’s Lionsgate Entertainment Films) along with Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, which also served as the movie’s distributor in the United States." However, later it mentions that when the studio tried to switch the location for a screening of Brewster McCloud at Houston's Astrodome, "it “was prevented by the danger of a law suit.”" This suggests that MGM may not have been the final authority or sole distributor of the film.
